intro: Tabernaemontana daktoensis, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid environment to flourish.
